sen.j: 京都市交響楽団（きょうとしこうきょうがくだん、Kyoto Symphony Orchestra）は、京都市に本拠を置くプロのオーケストラ。
sen.e: Kyoto Symphony Orchestra is a professional orchestra headquartered in Kyoto City.
Kyoto Symphony Orchestra is a professional orchestra headquartered in Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Kyoto Symphony Orchestra is a professional orchestra headquartered in Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 通称は京響（きょうきょう）。
sen.e: The name Kyokyo is commonly known.
It is commonly known by its Japanese abbreviation Kyokyo.
sen.cmt: Reworded sentence
sen.e: It is commonly known by its abbreviation Kyokyo.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1956年4月に、日本で唯一の自治体直営のオーケストラとして創立された。
sen.e: In April 1956, it was founded as an only orchestra in Japan which was directly managed by a municipality.
In April 1956, it was founded as an only orchestra in Japan which was directly managed by a municipality.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In April 1956, it was founded as the only orchestra in Japan which was directly managed by a municipality.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 現在の常任指揮者は広上淳一、桂冠指揮者に大友直人。
sen.e: The regular conductor at present is Junichi HIROKAMI and the Conductor Laureate is Naoto OTOMO.
The current regular conductor is Junichi HIROKAMI and the Conductor Laureate is Naoto OTOMO.
sen.cmt: "at present"→"current" and moved
sen.e: The present regular conductor is Junichi HIROKAMI and the Conductor Laureate is Naoto OTOMO.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 現在は京都コンサートホールで毎月1回の定期演奏会を開催しており、4管編成、自治体直営の利を活かして演奏機会の少ない曲を採り上げることも多い。
sen.e: At present, it gives the Subscription Concert once a month in the Kyoto Concert Hall and, exploiting advantages of the four-pipe composition [4管編成 定訳不明] direct management by a municipality,

At present, it gives a Subscription Concert once a month in the Kyoto Concert Hall and, taking advantage of its modern composition and its direct management by a municipality, it also gives many performances of works that otherwise would have little chance of being heard.
sen.cmt: "the"→"a""exploiting advantages"→"taking advantage""the"→"its""four-pipe"→"modern" - I think 4管編成 refers to large modern orchestras, as opposed to romantic or baroque etc., onesAdded "its"Added final clause that was missing from trans 1
sen.e: At present, it gives a Subscription Concert once a month in the Kyoto Concert Hall and, taking advantage of its large modern orchestra and its direct management by a municipality, it also gives a lot of performances of works that otherwise would have little chance of being heard.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: また「こどものためのコンサート」を定期的なシリーズとして開催する。
sen.e: It also gives "Kodomono tameno concert" (concert for children) as a regular series.
It also gives "Kodomono tameno concert" (concert for children) as a regular series.
sen.cmt: Added "also"
sen.e: It also presents 'Kodomono tameno concert' (concert for children) as a regular series.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 2005年にプラハ交響楽団（FOK）と姉妹オーケストラ盟約を締結。
sen.e: In 2005, it concluded a sister orchestra covenant [姉妹オーケストラ盟約 定訳不明] with the Prague Symphony Orchestra.
In 2005, it concluded a sister orchestra agreement with the Prague Symphony Orchestra.
sen.cmt: "covenant"→"agreement"
sen.e: In 2005, it formed a sister orchestra ties with the Prague Symphony Orchestra.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 沿革
sen.e: History
History
sen.cmt: OK
sen.e: History
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 1956年 4月に自治体直営のオーケストラとして創立し、6月18日、先斗町歌舞練場に於いて披露演奏会を開催。
sen.e: In April 1956, it was established an orchestra which was directly operated by a municipality and gave on June 18 a concert for introduction in the Pontocho Kaburenjo Theater.
It was established in April 1956 as an orchestra directly operated by a municipality and gave its first public performance on June 18 in the Pontocho Kaburenjo Theater.
sen.cmt: Moved "it was established"Added "as"Deleted "which was""a concert for introduction"→"its first public performance""in"→"at"
sen.e: In April 1956, it was established as an orchestra directly operated by a municipality and gave its first public performance on June 18 in the Pontocho Kaburenjo Theater.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: この翌日（6月19日）には円山公園 (京都府)野外音楽堂にて第1回定期演奏会を開催
sen.e: On the next day (June 19), it gave the first Subscription Concert in the outdoor concert hall of the Maruyama Park (Kyoto Prefecture).
On the next day (June 19), it gave its first Subscription Concert at the outdoor concert hall in Maruyama Park (Kyoto Prefecture).
sen.cmt: "the"→"its""in"→"at""of the"→"in"
sen.e: On the next day June 19, it gave its first Subscription Concert at the outdoor concert hall in Maruyama Park (Kyoto Prefecture).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1959年 二期会との提携による「ヴォルフガング・アマデウス・モーツァルト・オペラシリーズ」で全国を巡業し、毎日音楽賞、大阪府民劇場賞、大阪府芸術祭賞を受賞
sen.e: In 1959, it made nationwide tours of performance of "Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart opera series" in cooperation with Nikikai (an opera foundation) and received THE MAINICHI NEWSPAPERS Awards for Music, the Osaka Fumin Hall Award, and Osaka Prefecture Art Festival Awards.
sen.cmt: 賞の名称はいずれも英文名が確認できないため仮訳です。
sen.e: In 1959, in cooperation with Nikikai Opera Foundation, it made a nationwide tour performing "Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart Opera Series" and received THE MAINICHI NEWSPAPER Award for Music, the Osaka Fumin Hall Award, and the Osaka Prefecture Art Festival Awards.
sen.cmt: Added "a"Made "tours" singular"of performance of"→"performing"Capitalised 'o', 's'Moved "in cooperation with Nikikai (an opera foundation)"Deleted brackets and "an"Capitalised 'o', 'f'Made "NEWSPAPERS", "Awards" singular Added "the"Made "Awards" singular
sen.e: In 1959, in cooperation with Nikikai Opera Foundation, Kyoto Symphony Orchestra made a nationwide tour performing 'Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart Opera Series' and received THE MAINICHI NEWSPAPER Award for Music, the Osaka Fumin Hall Award, and the Osaka Prefecture Art Festival Awards.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1961年 文部省芸術選奨を受ける
sen.e: In 1961, it received the Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology Awards for Art.
In 1961, it received the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology Award for Art.
sen.cmt: "Minister"→"Ministry"Made "Awards" singular
sen.e: In 1961, Kyoto Symphony Orchestra received the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology Award for Art.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1976年 初めての海外公演を香港にて実施
sen.e: In 1976, it gave the first overseas public performance in Hong Kong.
In 1976, it gave its first overseas public performance in Hong Kong.
sen.cmt: "the"→"its"
sen.e: In 1976, Kyoto Symphony Orchestra gave its first overseas public performance in Hong Kong.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1978年 京響委嘱作品5曲を集めたレコード『京都をイメージとした作品集』で「日本レコード・アカデミー大賞」を受賞
sen.e: In 1978, it received "Japan Record Academy Award" for its record "Kyoto wo imejishita sakuhinshu" (The Contemporary Music of Japan) which was a collection of five Kyokyo's commissioned works.
In 1978, it received the "Japan Record Academy Award" for its record "Kyoto wo imejishita sakuhinshu" (The Contemporary Music of Japan), a collection of five Kyokyo's commissioned works.
sen.cmt: Added "the""which was"→commaAdded "of"
sen.e: In 1978, Kyoto Symphony Orchestra received the 'Japan Record Academy Award' for its record "Kyoto wo imejishita sakuhinshu" (The Contemporary Music of Japan), a collection of five Kyokyo's commissioned works.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1987年 朝鮮民主主義人民共和国公演実施
sen.e: In 1987, it gave public performances in Democratic People's Republic of Korea (North Korea).
In 1987, it gave public performances in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (North Korea).
sen.cmt: Added "the"
sen.e: In 1987, Kyoto Symphony Orchestra gave public performances in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (North Korea).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1989年 フランス公演実施
sen.e: In 1989, it gave public performances in France.
In 1989, it gave public performances in France.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In 1989, Kyoto Symphony Orchestra gave public performances in France.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1995年 京都コンサートホール完成に伴い、本拠地をそれまでの京都会館より移転
sen.e: In 1995, following completion of construction of the Kyoto Concert Hall, it moved its base from the Kyoto Kaikan.
In 1995, following completion of construction of the Kyoto Concert Hall, it moved its base from the Kyoto Kaikan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In 1995, following completion of construction of the Kyoto Concert Hall, Kyoto Symphony Orchestra moved its base from the Kyoto Kaikan.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1997年 創立40周年記念事業の締めくくりとしてヨーロッパ5都市を巡る海外ツアーを敢行（井上道義が指揮者として同行）
sen.e: In 1997, it dared to carry out an overseas tours to visit five cities in Europe as a last event of commemorative operations for the fortieth anniversary of its foundation.
In 1997, as the finale to its fortieth anniversary celebrations, it carried out an overseas tour of five European cities, with Michiyoshi Inoue as conductor.
sen.cmt: Changed word orderReworded sentenceAdded "with Michiyoshi Inoue as conductor" from original
sen.e: In 1997, as the finale to its fortieth anniversary celebrations, Kyoto Symphony Orchestra carried out an overseas tour of five European cities, with Michiyoshi INOUE as conductor.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 1999年 この年から2001年にかけて、ウーヴェ・ムント（第10代常任指揮者）と共に、ジャン・シベリウス・ベドルジハ・スメタナ・バルトーク・ベーラ・グスタフ・マーラーの各作品を録音、ドイツのバジェット・レコードレーベル「アルテ・ノヴァ（ARTE NOVA）」を通じて全世界に向けてリリース
sen.e: From 1999 through 2001, together with Uwe Mund (the tenth regular conductor), it recorded works of Jean SIBELIUS, Bedřich SMETANA, Bela BARTOK and Gustav MAHLER and released to the whole world through a German budget record label "ARTE NOVA."

From 1999 through 2001, together with Uwe Mund (the tenth regular conductor), it recorded works by Jean SIBELIUS, Bedřich SMETANA, Bela BARTOK and Gustav MAHLER and released to the whole world through German budget record label "ARTE NOVA."
sen.cmt: "of"→"by""and"→comma"to the whole world"→"worldwide" Deleted "a"
sen.e: From 1999 through 2001, together with Uwe Mund (the tenth permanent conductor), it recorded works by Jean SIBELIUS, Bedrich SMETANA, Bela BARTOK and Gustav MAHLER and released to the whole world through German budget record label "ARTE NOVA."
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 2003年 大友直人（第11代常任指揮者）と共に西日本初の子供向け定期演奏会「こどものためのコンサート」を開始
sen.e: In 2003, together with Naoto OTOMO (the eleventh regular conductor, it launched the first regular concert for children in the western Japan, "Kodomono tameno concert."
In 2003, together with Naoto OTOMO, the eleventh regular conductor, it launched the first regular concert for children in the western Japan.
sen.cmt: "("→commaDeleted ", "Kodomono tameno concert"" - not necessary for English speakers, especially as it's in cell F11 too
sen.e: In 2003, together with Naoto OTOMO, the eleventh regular conductor, Kyoto Symphony Orchestra launched the first regular concert for children in the western Japan, 'Concert for Children'.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 2006年 創立50周年を迎え、記念の「バースデーコンサート」を先斗町歌舞練場で（6月18日）開催
sen.e: In 2006, to commemorate its fiftieth anniversary, it gave a commemorative "Birthday Concert"(June 18) in the Pontocho Kaburenjo Theater.
sen.cmt: 一原文一例文の例外措置
sen.e: In 2006, to commemorate its fiftieth anniversary, it gave a commemorative "Birthday Concert"(June 18) at the Pontocho Kaburenjo Theater
sen.cmt: "in"→"at"Deleted full stop to rejoin to cell F26
sen.e: In 2006, to commemorate its fiftieth anniversary, Kyoto Symphony Orchestra gave a commemorative "Birthday Concert"(June 18) at the Pontocho Kaburenjo Theater.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 更に11月には「京響創立50周年記念コンサートツアー」と銘打って国内主要都市を巡業
sen.e: In addition, in November, it made tours of performance in major cities in Japan under the name of "Kyokyo soritsu 50-shunen kinen concert tour (commemorative concert tour for the fiftieth anniversary of Kyokyo)".
sen.cmt: 一原文一例文の例外措置
sen.e: and, in November, it toured major cities in Japan with the "Kyokyo soritsu 50-shunen kinen concert tour (Kyokyo Fiftieth Anniversay Concert Tour)".
sen.cmt: "In addition"→"and""made tours of performance in"→"toured""under the name of"→"with the""commemorative concert tour for the fiftieth anniversary of Kyokyo"→"Kyokyo Fiftieth Anniversay Concert Tour"
sen.e: And, in November, it toured major cities in Japan with the title of 'Kyokyo soritsu 50-shunen kinen concert tour'.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 2009年 運営を京都市文化市民局から外郭団体の京都市音楽芸術文化振興財団に移管
sen.e: In 2009, its operation was transferred from the Culture and Citizens Affairs Bureau of Kyoto Prefecture to an extra-departmental organization, "Kyoto City music art cultural Promoting Foundation.
In 2009, its operation was transferred from the Culture and Citizens Affairs Bureau of Kyoto Prefecture to an extra-departmental organization, "Kyoto City music art cultural Promoting Foundation.
sen.cmt: OK - although the English name of "京都市音楽芸術文化振興財団" looks a bit strange, that's what they have on their website.
sen.e: In 2009, the operation of Kyoto Symphony Orchestra was transferred from the Culture and Citizens Affairs Bureau of Kyoto Prefecture to an extra-departmental organization, Kyoto City music art cultural Promoting Foundation.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。
